comment: The Dutch Defense. Black accepts a somewhat weakened pawn position for kingside attacking chances.
The Staunton Gambit. White gives up a pawn for strong attacking possibilities.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3
comment: The main idea of the gambit: If 4... exf3 5. Nxf3 White has strong pressure on the center and a lead in development while Black has weaknesses due to the missing f pawn. Nonetheless, it is sound to accept the gambit.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6
comment: Black prefers to give back the pawn to playing a defensive game.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4
comment: White is controlling the center. Black must find a way to contest it.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6
comment: It is very unusual to block the d pawn in this way. However, it is the only active move in this position.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5
comment: Pinning the knight and planning Nd5.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3
comment: White hopes to be able to use the open g file to attack the Black king.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Be7
comment: Breaking the pin and threatening 12... Nxd5 13. Bxe7 Nxe7 winning a piece.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Be7 12. Nxe7+ Qxe7 13. Qd2
comment: If Black plays passively, White will gain a huge advantage by castling queenside and using the open g file for an attack.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Be7 12. Nxe7+ Qxe7 13. Qd2 d5
comment: Taking advantage of the fact that White hasn't yet castled and that the e pawn is pinned.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Be7 12. Nxe7+ Qxe7 13. Qd2 d5 14. O-O-O
comment: White was faced with the choice of a passive defense and sacrificing a pawn for an attack. He chose the latter.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Be7 12. Nxe7+ Qxe7 13. Qd2 d5 14. O-O-O dxe4 15. fxe4 Qxe4 16. Bxf6
comment: If now 16... Qxh1 then 17. Bc4+ wins the queen.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Be7 12. Nxe7+ Qxe7 13. Qd2 d5 14. O-O-O dxe4 15. fxe4 Qxe4 16. Bxf6 Rxf6 17. Bg2
comment: White gains time attacking Black's exposed queen.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Be7 12. Nxe7+ Qxe7 13. Qd2 d5 14. O-O-O dxe4 15. fxe4 Qxe4 16. Bxf6 Rxf6 17. Bg2 Qe8
comment: To prevent 18. Qd8+

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Be7 12. Nxe7+ Qxe7 13. Qd2 d5 14. O-O-O dxe4 15. fxe4 Qxe4 16. Bxf6 Rxf6 17. Bg2 Qe8 18. Rhe1
comment: White controls most of the board now.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Be7 12. Nxe7+ Qxe7 13. Qd2 d5 14. O-O-O dxe4 15. fxe4 Qxe4 16. Bxf6 Rxf6 17. Bg2 Qe8 18. Rhe1 Qf8
comment: Black now threatens 19... Bg4 trapping White's rook on d1 and freeing his own rook on a8 to defend the back rank.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Be7 12. Nxe7+ Qxe7 13. Qd2 d5 14. O-O-O dxe4 15. fxe4 Qxe4 16. Bxf6 Rxf6 17. Bg2 Qe8 18. Rhe1 Qf8 19. Qd5+ Kh8 20. Qd8
comment: Threatening Re8 winning the queen. If 20... Qxd8 21. Rxd8+ Kh2 22. Ree8 winning the bishop.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Be7 12. Nxe7+ Qxe7 13. Qd2 d5 14. O-O-O dxe4 15. fxe4 Qxe4 16. Bxf6 Rxf6 17. Bg2 Qe8 18. Rhe1 Qf8 19. Qd5+ Kh8 20. Qd8 Bg4
comment: At last Black's queen rook and queen bishop are in the game.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Be7 12. Nxe7+ Qxe7 13. Qd2 d5 14. O-O-O dxe4 15. fxe4 Qxe4 16. Bxf6 Rxf6 17. Bg2 Qe8 18. Rhe1 Qf8 19. Qd5+ Kh8 20. Qd8 Bg4 21. Qxf8+ Raxf8 22. Rd4
comment: White is threatening 23. Rxg4 and 23. Bxb7

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Be7 12. Nxe7+ Qxe7 13. Qd2 d5 14. O-O-O dxe4 15. fxe4 Qxe4 16. Bxf6 Rxf6 17. Bg2 Qe8 18. Rhe1 Qf8 19. Qd5+ Kh8 20. Qd8 Bg4 21. Qxf8+ Raxf8 22. Rd4 Bc8
comment: Holding onto the material. Once the queen rook is developed, c8 is not such a bad place for the bishop.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Be7 12. Nxe7+ Qxe7 13. Qd2 d5 14. O-O-O dxe4 15. fxe4 Qxe4 16. Bxf6 Rxf6 17. Bg2 Qe8 18. Rhe1 Qf8 19. Qd5+ Kh8 20. Qd8 Bg4 21. Qxf8+ Raxf8 22. Rd4 Bc8 23. Re7
comment: Rooks on the seventh rank are very powerful.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Be7 12. Nxe7+ Qxe7 13. Qd2 d5 14. O-O-O dxe4 15. fxe4 Qxe4 16. Bxf6 Rxf6 17. Bg2 Qe8 18. Rhe1 Qf8 19. Qd5+ Kh8 20. Qd8 Bg4 21. Qxf8+ Raxf8 22. Rd4 Bc8 23. Re7 c6
comment: To save the pawn.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Be7 12. Nxe7+ Qxe7 13. Qd2 d5 14. O-O-O dxe4 15. fxe4 Qxe4 16. Bxf6 Rxf6 17. Bg2 Qe8 18. Rhe1 Qf8 19. Qd5+ Kh8 20. Qd8 Bg4 21. Qxf8+ Raxf8 22. Rd4 Bc8 23. Re7 c6 24. h4 Kg8
comment: Black can sense the end game is near and is bringing his king into the action!

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Be7 12. Nxe7+ Qxe7 13. Qd2 d5 14. O-O-O dxe4 15. fxe4 Qxe4 16. Bxf6 Rxf6 17. Bg2 Qe8 18. Rhe1 Qf8 19. Qd5+ Kh8 20. Qd8 Bg4 21. Qxf8+ Raxf8 22. Rd4 Bc8 23. Re7 c6 24. h4 Kg8 25. h5
comment: White wouldn't mind posting a bishop on g6. However, this pawn is going to be weak and attacked by the Black king.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Be7 12. Nxe7+ Qxe7 13. Qd2 d5 14. O-O-O dxe4 15. fxe4 Qxe4 16. Bxf6 Rxf6 17. Bg2 Qe8 18. Rhe1 Qf8 19. Qd5+ Kh8 20. Qd8 Bg4 21. Qxf8+ Raxf8 22. Rd4 Bc8 23. Re7 c6 24. h4 Kg8 25. h5 R6f7
comment: Black must retain control of his own second rank.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Be7 12. Nxe7+ Qxe7 13. Qd2 d5 14. O-O-O dxe4 15. fxe4 Qxe4 16. Bxf6 Rxf6 17. Bg2 Qe8 18. Rhe1 Qf8 19. Qd5+ Kh8 20. Qd8 Bg4 21. Qxf8+ Raxf8 22. Rd4 Bc8 23. Re7 c6 24. h4 Kg8 25. h5 R6f7 26. Rxf7 Kxf7
comment: To bring the king closer to the pawn on h5.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Be7 12. Nxe7+ Qxe7 13. Qd2 d5 14. O-O-O dxe4 15. fxe4 Qxe4 16. Bxf6 Rxf6 17. Bg2 Qe8 18. Rhe1 Qf8 19. Qd5+ Kh8 20. Qd8 Bg4 21. Qxf8+ Raxf8 22. Rd4 Bc8 23. Re7 c6 24. h4 Kg8 25. h5 R6f7 26. Rxf7 Kxf7 27. Kd2 Kf6 28. Ke3 Kg5 29. Bf3
comment: White is now on the defensive.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Be7 12. Nxe7+ Qxe7 13. Qd2 d5 14. O-O-O dxe4 15. fxe4 Qxe4 16. comment: Threatening 30... Bxc2

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Be7 12. Nxe7+ Qxe7 13. Qd2 d5 14. O-O-O dxe4 15. fxe4 Qxe4 16. Bxf6 Rxf6 17. Bg2 Qe8 18. Rhe1 Qf8 19. Qd5+ Kh8 20. Qd8 Bg4 21. Qxf8+ Raxf8 22. Rd4 Bc8 23. Re7 c6 24. h4 Kg8 25. h5 R6f7 26. Rxf7 Kxf7 27. Kd2 Kf6 28. Ke3 Kg5 29. Bf3 Bf5 30. c3 Re8+
comment: White's most active piece is his rook. Black plans to play 31... Re7 and 32... Rd7 exchanging rooks. With the more active pieces and extra pawn, Black would win easily.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Be7 12. Nxe7+ Qxe7 13. Qd2 d5 14. O-O-O dxe4 15. fxe4 Qxe4 16. Kf2 Re7 32. b4
comment: Desperately seeking counterplay.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Be7 12. Nxe7+ Qxe7 13. Qd2 d5 14. O-O-O dxe4 15. fxe4 Qxe4 16. Kf2 Re7 32. b4 Rd7 33. Rc4
comment: This leads to the loss of the a pawn. But White cannot afford to trade rooks.

Kf2 Re7 32. b4 Rd7 33. Rc4 Be6 34. Re4 Bxa2 35. Re5+ Kf4 36. Ra5
comment: Attacking the bishop and the pawn.

Kf2 Re7 32. b4 Rd7 33. Rc4 Be6 34. Re4 Bxa2 35. Re5+ Kf4 36. Ra5 Rd2+ 37. Ke1 Rh2 38. Be2 Be6
comment: If 39. Rxa7 then 39... Ke3 40. Bf1 (Not 40. Bd1 Rh1#.) 40... Rh1 followed by 41. Bc4 winning the bishop.

moves: 1. d4 f5 2. e4 fxe4 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. f3 Nc6 5. fxe4 e5 6. dxe5 Nxe5 7. Nf3 Bd6 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nd5 Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Be7 12. Nxe7+ Qxe7 13. Qd2 d5 14. O-O-O dxe4 15. fxe4 Qxe4 16. Kf2 Re7 32. b4 Rd7 33. Rc4 Be6 34. Re4 Bxa2 35. Re5+ Kf4 36. Ra5 Rd2+ 37. Ke1 Rh2 38. Be2 Be6 39. Bf1 Ra2
comment: White resigned. White has no hope in the ending after 40. Rxa2 Bxa2 If 40. Rc5 then 40... Bd5 41. Bc4 Ra1+ 42. Kd2 b6 trapping the rook
